alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 10:34PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Phelps, northwestern Kearney and western Buffalo Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1033 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elm Creek to 8 miles northwest of Funk to near Holdrege. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Odessa around 1040 PM CDT. Axtell around 1050 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Riverdale, Kearney and Minden. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 255 and 282. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Nebraska.
